column4: can anyone help me with this error? http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/19412
ah ok, sorry i dont know about lvm
i don't think it has to do with lvm.. but i could be wrong
do you have the lvm packages installed? can the lvm tools see your lvm config correctly?
i assume so, all the tools seems to work
is there already a working filesystem on /dev/storage, or did you just create it?
it is created by lvm, it is aucutally /dev/stor/storage
ok, but you have run some form of mkfs on /dev/stor/storage since you created it with the lvm tools?
hrm, i am not sure then. if nobody else can help in here you should probably ask on the ubuntu forums
there is a backup (or several backups) of the superblock but i am not sure about recovering it
does fsck find anything on that volume?
nope it is ext3 not reiser
there is fsck for ext3 too :)
yes the e2fsck sees it it says : Superblock has an invalid ext3 hournal (inode 8). Clear<y>? will this delete everything on the drive?
i am not exactly sure what that message means, sorry..
i *think* it is safe to clear an ext3 journal if the drive was properly unmounted last time, but i am not 100% on that
